definitions: A written guarantee, issued to the purchaser of an article by its manufacturer, promising to repair or replace it if necessary within a specified period.
A guarantee or promise by the seller of a product that it will be repaired or replaced if it has problems within a certain period.
A legal promise that something is true or will happen.
examples: The car comes with a three-year warranty.
Make sure to keep your warranty card.
The warranty covers parts and labor.
